name: CVE-2017-3604
description: Vulnerability in the Data Store component of Oracle Berkeley DB. The supported version that is affected is Prior to 6.2.32. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with logon to the infrastructure where Data Store executes to compromise Data Store. Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than the attacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of Data Store. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 7.0 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

description: Vulnerability in the Data Store component of Oracle Berkeley DB. The supported version that is affected is Prior to 6.2.32. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with logon to the infrastructure where Data Store executes to compromise Data Store. Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than the attacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of Data Store. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 7.0 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

description: Vulnerability in the Data Store component of Oracle Berkeley DB. The supported version that is affected is Prior to 6.2.32. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with logon to the infrastructure where Data Store executes to compromise Data Store. Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than the attacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of Data Store. name: BDSA-2017-0611 (CVE-2017-10140)
description:
A vulnerability in Berkley DB allows for information disclosure from extremely sensitive system files, including `/etc/shadow`, which can lead to a full system compromise.

This vulnerability also allows privilege escalation in affected Postfix versions.

name: CVE-2019-8457
description: SQLite3 from 3.6.0 to and including 3.27.2 is vulnerable to heap out-of-bound read in the rtreenode() function when handling invalid rtree tables.

name: BDSA-2020-1718 (CVE-2020-2981)
description: An unspecified, difficult to exploit vulnerability in the Data Store component of Berkeley DB can allow a local unauthenticated attacker to fully compromise the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the database. User interaction is required for a successful attack.

name: BDSA-2018-3058 (CVE-2018-14618)
description:
An integer overflow is present in the NTLM authentication code in Libcurl. This can be exploited by an attacker to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) condition. This issue is almost identical to CVE-2017-8816. 

The issue is only present on 32-bit systems. It also requires the password field to use more than 2GB of memory which should be rare.

name: BDSA-2018-3833 (CVE-2018-16839)
description: curl is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper buffer allocation during SASL authentication on 32-bit systems. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted username.

name: BDSA-2018-3835 (CVE-2018-16840)
description: curl is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper handling of closing session handles. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted request.

name: BDSA-2018-3834 (CVE-2018-16842)
description: curl is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper processing of command-line warning and informational messages. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted request.

name: BDSA-2018-4736 (CVE-2019-3822)
description: Libcurl contains a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability. To exploit, a remote attacker must supply a specially crafted NTLM authentication message to the component. If successfully exploited, a denial-of-service (DoS) will occur due to the component crashing.

name: BDSA-2019-0349 (CVE-2019-3823)
description: Libcurl contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. This could allow an attacker to supply a specially crafted SMTP message which causes a read beyond the allocated buffer. If successfully exploited, a denial-of-service (DoS) will occur due to the component crashing.

name: BDSA-2019-0362 (CVE-2018-16890)
description: Libcurl contains an integer overflow vulnerability that leads to an out-of-bounds read. To exploit, a remote attacker must supply a specially crafted NTLM authentication message to the component. If successfully exploited, a denial-of-service (DoS) will occur due to the component crashing.

name: BDSA-2019-1608 (CVE-2019-5436)
description: Libcurl contains a buffer overflow flaw. This could be exploited by a remote attacker to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) by crashing the application.

name: CVE-2019-5443
description: A non-privileged user or program can put code and a config file in a known non-privileged path (under C:/usr/local/) that will make curl <= 7.65.1 automatically run the code (as an openssl "engine") on invocation. If that curl is invoked by a privileged user it can do anything it wants.

name: BDSA-2019-2909 (CVE-2019-5482)
description: Curl contains a heap-based buffer overflow. This could be exploited by a remote attacker via the TFTP protocol to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) due to application crash.

name: BDSA-2019-2911 (CVE-2019-5481)
description: Curl contains a use-after-free vulnerability. This could be exploited by a remote attacker via a kerberos FTP data transfer to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) due to an application crash.

name: BDSA-2020-1510
description: Curl contains a vulnerability in the validation of command options that allows a malicious server to trick it into overwriting local files.

name: BDSA-2020-1933
description: cURL is vulnerable to local file overwrites due to improper handling of non-readable files. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by tricking a victim into performing maliciously crafted requests.

name: BDSA-2020-2103 (CVE-2020-8231)
description: libcurl is vulnerable to data exposure. This could cause data to be unintentionally sent over an existing connection to the wrong recipient.

name: BDSA-2020-3058
description: curl is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper handling of invalid file uploads. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a system with maliciously crafted input.

name: BDSA-2020-3694 (CVE-2020-8284)
description: curl could be tricked by a malicious FTP server to connect to another server and therefore potentially disclose private information. This especially affects setups where the URL passed to curl is controlled by a remote attacker - information disclosure attacks could be performed using the vulnerable curl instance without the need of a separate server.

name: BDSA-2020-3697 (CVE-2020-8285)
description: Libcurl contains a stack overflow vulnerability in its FTP wildcard matching functionality (`CURLOPT_WILDCARDMATCH`) because of uncontrolled recursion. An attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-3711 (CVE-2020-8286)
description: Libcurl does not properly validate certificates when the `OCSP Stapling` functionality is being used. Attackers can exploit this flaw to cause an authentication bypass condition by substituting the `OCSP` response with one which results in a successful validation.

name: BDSA-2021-0022
description: It was found that a feature of the Windows operating system leaves curl vulnerable to SMB access smuggling. This could be used to trick users into unknowingly accessing remote files via crafted FILE URLs.

name: BDSA-2021-0825 (CVE-2021-22876)
description: If configured in a certain way, curl does not strip off user credentials from the URL when automatically populating the Referer header in outgoing HTTP requests. This means that sensitive information could be leaked to the server that is the target of the second HTTP request.

name: BDSA-2021-1586 (CVE-2021-22898)
description:
curl is vulnerable to a sensitive information disclosure due to a flaw in the implementation of the `CURLOPT_TELNETOPTIONS` option.

The flaw could cause curl to pass uninitialized data from a stack based buffer to the server, potentially leaking sensitive information.

name: BDSA-2021-1595 (CVE-2021-22897)
description:
curl, when using Schannel, is vulnerable to a weakened transport security issue due to a flaw in how ciphers are selected and used for multiple concurrent transfers.

This issue means that the last transfer to set the ciphers will control the set used by all transfers, potentially making these transfers more vulnerable to attack.

name: BDSA-2021-2140 (CVE-2021-22922)
description: Curl contains a vulnerability that may allow content spoofing attacks to occur.  A remote attacker can craft content containing a metalink that will bypass curls hash integrity checks. libcurl is not affected by this vulnerability.

name: BDSA-2021-2142 (CVE-2021-22923)
description:
Curl contains a information exposure vulnerability.  This vulnerability can cause Curl to unexpectedly send credentials (username, password) to servers if a user has downloaded a metalink XML file.

libcurl is not affected by this vulnerability.

name: BDSA-2021-2147 (CVE-2021-22924)
description: libcurl contains a vulnerability that can cause old connections to be incorrectly reused.  This can result in curl attempting to connect to an incorrect address.

name: BDSA-2021-2154 (CVE-2021-22926)
description: libcurl contains a vulnerability that can cause the wrong client certificate to be used in some rare circumstances. This can occur when libcurl is built to use the macOS native TLS library Secure Transport.

name: BDSA-2021-2151 (CVE-2021-22925)
description: Curl contains a content disclosure vulnerability.  This vulnerability is due to an incomplete fix for CVE-2021-22898. The vulnerability could cause curl to pass uninitialized data from a stack based buffer to the server, potentially leaking sensitive information.

name: BDSA-2021-2781 (CVE-2021-22946)
description: Curl is vulnerable to sensitive information exposure due to a bypass of necessary cryptography. This can allow an attacker to ensure operations are performed without the use of TLS, which can expose sensitive data in clear text over the network.

name: BDSA-2021-2786 (CVE-2021-22947)
description: Curl is vulnerable to STARTTLS protocol injection. This can allow an attacker to use a man-in-the-middle (MitM) attack in order to inject fake IMAP, POP3, or FTP responses.

name: BDSA-2019-4015 (CVE-2019-19906)
description: It was discovered that cyrus-sasl contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this using a malformed LDAP packet to trigger a memory error leading to an denial-of-service (DoS) via application crash.

name: BDSA-2019-1766 (CVE-2019-12749)
description: An improper authentication vulnerability has been discovered in DBus. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof authentication values and gain unauthorized access and escalated privileges.

name: BDSA-2020-1308 (CVE-2020-12049)
description: FreeDesktop's DBus contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. A malicious application or process can leak file descriptors through DBus messages.  This can be used to exhaust available memory on a system.

name: BDSA-2020-3898
description: D-Bus contains a use-after-free vulnerability due to improper access control. D-Bus fails to properly handle a condition where two usernames have the same numeric UID. An attacker could exploit this flaw to trigger an denial-of-service (DoS) condition via application crash.

name: BDSA-2020-4179
description: FreeDesktop D-Bus is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via a use-after-free triggered when Unix usernames have the same numeric UID. This could also result in other undefined behaviour, possibly including incorrect authorization decisions.

name: BDSA-2018-1858 (CVE-2018-10360)
description: file is vulnerable to an out-of-bounds read via function `do_core_note`. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious ELF file to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2019-0454
description: File is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to stack-based buffer over-read flaw. An attacker could cause an application crash by supplying malicious input.

name: BDSA-2019-0511
description: File is vulnerable to denial-of-service. An attacker could supply a maliciously crafted input in order to cause an application crash.

name: BDSA-2019-0517
description: File is vulnerable to denial-of-service. An attacker could supply a maliciously crafted input in order to cause an application crash.

name: BDSA-2019-0549
description: File contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. A flaw in the use of the `memcpy` function could allow an attacker to retrieve sensitive information from memory. In addition, an attacker could trick a victim into supplying a specially crafted ELF file to the component. If successfully exploited a denial-of-service (DoS) will occur.

name: BDSA-2019-3321 (CVE-2019-18218)
description: File contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this by supplying a victim with a specially crafted file that when processed exceeds the size of the buffer triggering a denial-of-service (DoS) via application crash.

name: BDSA-2016-0079
description: GNU Awk (Gawk) is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via a null pointer dereference in `awkgram.y`. By tricking a user into running a malicious gawk script an attacker could crash the gawk process.

name: BDSA-2018-3803 (CVE-2018-18751)
description: GNU gettext is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper handling of translation files when generating binary message catalogs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted  `.po` file.

name: BDSA-2018-3041
description: GNOME GLib contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability due to incorrect UTF-8 character parsing. This allows an attacker to cause the process to crash leading to a denial-of-service (DoS) by supplying a maliciously crafted file to the parser.

name: BDSA-2018-3054
description: GNOME GLib contains a NULL pointer dereference vulnerability due to incorrect handling of closing tags by the error handling code. This allows an attacker to cause the process to crash leading to denial-of-service (DoS) by supplying a maliciously crafted file to the parser.

name: BDSA-2018-3783
description: An out-of-bounds read has been discovered in Gnome GLib. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by a malicious crafted input string to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2018-3787
description: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in Gnome GLib. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability through a maliciously crafted input to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2018-3795
description: An infinite loop vulnerability has been discovered in Gnome GLib. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2018-3790
description: A buffer underwrite vulnerability has been discovered in Gnome GLib. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by a malicious crafted file to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2018-3793
description: An improper input validation vulnerability has been discovered in Gnome GLib. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious request which could cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2019-0685
description: GNOME's GLib contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. This could be exploited by a remote attacker to crash an application using the library.

name: BDSA-2019-1665 (CVE-2019-12450)
description: GNOME GLib is vulnerable to arbitrary file access due to incorrectly set permissions during a file copy operation. The flawed copy operation creates new files with default permissions and sets correct permissions only after copying completes. This leaves an attacker a window of opportunity when the file may be open to arbitrary access. Depending on how the function is implemented in the target application this has a potential of leading to arbitrary code execution on the underlying host.

name: BDSA-2019-1927 (CVE-2019-13012)
description: An improper access control vulnerability has been discovered in GNOME GLib. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to access restricted directories that utilize default file permissions to read sensitive information or execute arbitrary code against the system.

name: BDSA-2020-3769 (CVE-2020-35457)
description:
Gnome GLib is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via an out-of-bounds write triggered by an integer overflow in the `g_option_group_add_entries` function.  

This issue is disputed by the vendor who has stated: "Realistically this is not a security issue. The standard pattern is for callers to provide a static list of option entries in a fixed number of calls to `g_option_group_add_entries()`."

The reporter states: "I do not think this bug is a security concern at this time because I do not know of a realistic scenario where `group->n_entries` or `n_entries` would become sufficiently large to trigger the bug. However, this should be patched to be on the safe side."

name: BDSA-2021-0386 (CVE-2021-27218)
description:
GLib is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the improper management of system memory resources. An attacker could cause unintended behavior by causing the application to process maliciously crafted input. This unintended behavior may impact performance or cause a crash.

It should be noted that this vulnerability is platform-dependent, and only affects 64-bit architectures.

name: BDSA-2021-0383 (CVE-2021-27219)
description:
GLib is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the improper handling of numerical values in memory. A remote attacker could cause a vulnerable application to crash by causing it to process maliciously crafted input.

It should be noted that this issue is platform specific, and only affects 64-bit systems.

name: BDSA-2021-0638 (CVE-2021-28153)
description: Glib is vulnerable to symlink attacks due to improper processing of archives in the `file-roller` archive manager. This could allow an attacker to overwrite arbitrary files using a maliciously crafted archive.

name: BDSA-2017-4079
description: glib is vulnerable to privilege escalation due to the improper processing of charset aliases. This could allow an unprivileged attacker to obtain sensitive information from files owned by privileged users.

name: BDSA-2018-4142 (CVE-2018-19591)
description: Glibc contains a denial-of-service (DoS) flaw. The component fails to sanitize long interface names when creating a new socket descriptor. This could be exploited by an attacker to trigger a resource leak which causes the application to hang.

name: BDSA-2019-0174 (CVE-2019-6488)
description: GNU C Library (glibc) is vulnerable to denial of service on x32 architectures. An attacker could exploit this to cause a segmentation fault resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2016-1590 (CVE-2016-10739)
description: GNU C Library (glibc) is vulnerable to HTTP header injection because the IPv4 address parser ignores trailing whitespace and all characters after it. This may lead to data or command injection issues in applications that make use of the vulnerable library.

name: BDSA-2019-0288 (CVE-2019-7309)
description: An unchecked return value has been discovered in GNU glibc/libc. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: CVE-2009-5155
description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match.

name: BDSA-2019-0569 (CVE-2019-9192)
description: The Gnu C library is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to infinite recursion called by a self-referencing function. An attacker could cause a victim's instance of the application to crash by tricking them into running the program with crafted input.

name: BDSA-2019-0547 (CVE-2019-9169)
description: The Gnu C library is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the mismanagement of system memory resources. An attacker could cause a victim's instance of the application to crash by tricking them into running the program using crafted input.

name: BDSA-2019-0593 (CVE-2018-20796)
description: The Gnu C library is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to infinite recursion caused by a self-referencing function. An attacker could cause a victim's instance of the application to crash by tricking them into running the program with crafted input.

name: BDSA-2018-5009
description: glibc is vulnerable to is vulnerable to stack overflow protection bypass due to improper handling of stack canary data structures. This could allow an attacker to leverage existing stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities.

name: BDSA-2018-5010
description: glibc is vulnerable to arbitrary code execution due to improper memory management when handling ELF files. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a victim with a maliciously crafted ELF file.

name: BDSA-2018-5021
description: glibc is vulnerable to memory protection bypass due to improper memory management with thread caches. This could be leveraged by an attacker to deduce the location of stack/heap memory in order to bypass address space layout randomization (ASLR) protections and successfully exploit memory corruption vulnerabilities.

name: BDSA-2018-5020
description: glibc is vulnerable to memory protection bypass due to improper memory management during thread creation. This could be leveraged by an attacker to deduce the location of heap memory in order to bypass address space layout randomization (ASLR) protections and successfully exploit memory corruption vulnerabilities.

name: BDSA-2019-3660 (CVE-2019-19126)
description:
The GNU C Library (glibc) contains a flaw which makes it possible for a local attacker to weaken ASLR strength on setuid binaries, making it easier for them to perform other attacks.  

The vulnerability only applies on x86-64 architecture.

name: BDSA-2020-0371 (CVE-2020-10029)
description: It was discovered that libc contains a stack corruption vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious input to cause a stack-based buffer overflow leading to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2020-0631 (CVE-2020-6096)
description: GNU glibc is vulnerable to memory corruption via a signed comparison issue in the ARMv7 `memcpy()` implementation.

name: BDSA-2020-0825 (CVE-2020-1751)
description: glibc contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in the PowerPC architecture's backtrace functionality.  This allows an attacker to cause a system using glibc's backtrace to crash by creating or running a crafted program.

name: BDSA-2020-0972 (CVE-2020-1752)
description: Glibc is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via a use-after-free in the `glob` function. A local attacker could take advantage this using a crafted path which would trigger a DoS condition when processed by the glob function.

name: BDSA-2020-3636
description: GNU C Library (glibc) is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition due to an assertion failure that will result in an application crash.

name: BDSA-2019-4985 (CVE-2019-25013)
description: GNU glibc iconv tool contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. It is caused by a crash which occurs when converting invalid EUC-KR encoding to UTF-8.

name: BDSA-2021-0227 (CVE-2021-3326)
description: glibc is vulnerable to a reachable assertion flaw in the handling of specially crafted `ISO-2022-JP-3` encoding input sequences. A remote attacker could leverage this to crash the end application, causing a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2021-1584 (CVE-2021-33574)
description:
The GNU C Library (glibc) is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition due to the presence of a use-after-free issue in the `mq_notify()` function.

`mq_notify()` can attempt to use objects that have been separately allocated leading to instability or a crash.

name: BDSA-2020-4482 (CVE-2020-27618)
description:
The GNU C Library (glibc) is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) issue due to the presence of an infinite loop flaw in the `iconv` program.

An attacker could invoke the `iconv` program with the `-c` option and supply a crafted input in order to trigger the infinite loop and cause a `iconv` to hang.

name: BDSA-2017-4062
description:
The GNU C Library (glibc) is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) issue due to the presence of an infinite loop flaw in the `iconv` program.

An attacker could invoke the `iconv` program with the `-c` option and supply a crafted input in order to trigger the infinite loop and cause a `iconv` to hang.

name: BDSA-2021-2207 (CVE-2021-35942)
description:
The GNU C Library (glibc) is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition due to a lack of sufficient validation in the `parse_param()` function.

An attacker could submit a crafted pattern in order to impact stability to cause a crash, or potentially use this issue in order to disclose information due to how a 'wild read' occurs.

name: CVE-2021-38604
description: In librt in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.34, sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/mq_notify.c mishandles certain NOTIFY_REMOVED data, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. NOTE: this vulnerability was introduced as a side effect of the CVE-2021-33574 fix.

name: CVE-2016-2037
description: The cpio_safer_name_suffix function in util.c in cpio 2.11 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) via a crafted cpio file.

name: BDSA-2019-3420 (CVE-2019-14866)
description: cpio is vulnerable to privilege escalation due to improper validation of TAR file headers. This could allow a local attacker to generate and overwrite files with permissions that they do not own.

name: BDSA-2021-2384 (CVE-2021-38185)
description: GNU cpio is vulnerable to arbitrary code execution due to a memory corruption that can be triggered by reading a crafted pattern file.

name: CVE-2015-8370
description: Multiple integer underflows in Grub2 1.98 through 2.02 allow physically proximate attackers to bypass authentication, obtain sensitive information, or cause a denial of service (disk corruption) via backspace characters in the (1) grub_username_get function in grub-core/normal/auth.c or the (2) grub_password_get function in lib/crypto.c, which trigger an "Off-by-two" or "Out of bounds overwrite" memory error.

name: BDSA-2019-3754
description: The `grub-set-bootflag` application from the `grub2-tools-minimal`rpm contains a configuration file truncation vulnerability. A local attacker could leverage this to cause the system to become un-bootable, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-1924 (CVE-2020-10713)
description: Grub2 contains a arbitrary code execution vulnerability. This vulnerability allows a privileged local attacker to bypass the protection provided by secure boot and load arbitrary code into memory.  This can result in a total system compromise. For successful exploitation, an attacker needs to have privileged (root) access to a system using the Grub2 bootloader, and be able to modify system files required during the boot process.

name: BDSA-2020-1928 (CVE-2020-14309)
description: Grub2 contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. This allows a local privileged attacker that is able to write to system files the ability to cause the boot process to crash due to memory corruption.

name: BDSA-2020-1915 (CVE-2020-14311)
description: Grub2 contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. This allows a local privileged attacker that is able to write to system files the ability to cause the boot process to crash due to memory corruption.

name: BDSA-2020-1920 (CVE-2020-14308)
description: Grub2 contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability that can be used by a privileged attacker to crash the bootloader.

name: BDSA-2020-1914 (CVE-2020-14310)
description: Grub2 contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This allows a local privileged attacker that is able to write to system files to cause the boot process to crash due to memory corruption.

name: BDSA-2020-1913 (CVE-2020-15705)
description: Grub2 packages for Linux distributions are vulnerable to secure boot bypass due to improper validation of kernel signatures. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability on systems where the kernel signing certificate is imported directly into the secure boot database, and the the Grub image is booted directly without the shim pre-bootloader.

name: BDSA-2020-1916 (CVE-2020-15706)
description: Grub2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper handling of memory operations in the secure boot process. This could allow a local privileged attacker that is able to write to system files to cause the boot process to crash due to memory corruption.

name: BDSA-2020-1917 (CVE-2020-15707)
description: Grub2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper handling of buffer operations in the secure boot process. This could allow a local privileged attacker that is able to write to system files to cause the boot process to crash due to memory corruption.

name: BDSA-2020-4228 (CVE-2020-25647)
description: Grub2 is vulnerable to the bypassing of SecureBoot protections due to the improper management of system memory resources. An attacker could exploit this issue via a malicious USB device in order to potentially recover or modify sensitive data, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-4229 (CVE-2020-25632)
description: Grub2 is vulnerable to the bypassing of SecureBoot protection mechanisms due to the improper management of dependencies. An attacker could trigger a use-after-free by executing a malicious command. This could potentially allow them to obtain or modify sensitive data, or to cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-4227 (CVE-2020-27749)
description: Grub2 is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow due to the improper management of system memory resources. An attacker could use a maliciously crafted command-line statement in order to trigger this overflow, which may allow them to redirect code execution or bypass SecureBoot protections.

name: BDSA-2020-4226 (CVE-2020-27779)
description: Grub2 is vulnerable to the circumvention of SecureBoot protections due to a failure to respect restrictions on certain portions of memory. An attacker could potentially use the command to subvert the secure boot process, which could allow them to obtain or modify sensitive data, or to cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-4231 (CVE-2020-14372)
description: Grub2 is vulnerable to the bypassing of SecureBoot protections due to insufficient restrictions on the `acpi` command. A local attacker could use this command to subvert SecureBoot protections, which in turn could allow them to obtain or modify sensitive data, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2021-0537 (CVE-2021-20233)
description: Grub2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the improper management of system memory resources. A local attacker could cause a vulnerable system to crash via maliciously crafted input that contains multiple quote characters.

name: BDSA-2021-0536 (CVE-2021-20225)
description: Grub2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the improper management of system memory resources. A local attacker could cause a vulnerable system to crash via a maliciously crafted command that contains multiple short argument flags.

name: BDSA-2021-0674 (CVE-2021-3418)
description: Grub2 Distribution Packages contain a vulnerability in their kernel signature validation mechanism. An attacker having administrative access to the system could exploit this flaw to cause a secure boot bypass.

name: BDSA-2018-4483 (CVE-2018-20482)
description: An infinite loop vulnerability has been discovered in GNU Tar. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability through a maliciously crafted file to contain large amount of NULL bytes. This can cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2019-0804 (CVE-2019-9923)
description: Tar is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) as it may attempt to reference an empty memory region when decompressing malformed archives. An attacker could leverage this flaw to cause a crash by supplying a crafted file or tricking a user into doing so.

name: BDSA-2021-0803 (CVE-2021-20193)
description: tar contains a vulnerability to denial-of-service (DoS) due to a memory leak error which causes an uncontrolled consumption of memory. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability via a crafted file to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2020-2292 (CVE-2020-24659)
description: GnuTLS is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via null pointer dereference. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by tricking a user in to connecting to a malicious TLS endpoint using an application linked against GnuTLS in order to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2021-0645 (CVE-2021-20232)
description: GnuTLS contains a use-after-free vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue may allow attackers to cause memory corruption and trigger a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2021-0649 (CVE-2021-20231)
description: GnuTLS contains a use-after-free vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue may allow attackers to cause memory corruption and trigger a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-1108 (CVE-2020-12762)
description: json-c is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper validation of user-supplied JSON input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a system with a maliciously crafted file.

name: BDSA-2020-3215 (CVE-2020-28196)
description: Kerberos 5 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to uncontrolled recursion. A remote unauthenticated attacker could cause a vulnerable instance of the application to crash by sending a maliciously crafted ASN.1 encoded Kerberos message to that instance.

name: BDSA-2021-2206 (CVE-2021-36222)
description: MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to a memory management error in the Key Distribution Center (KDC). The vulnerability can be triggered by a remote unauthenticated attacker and results in a crash.

name: BDSA-2021-2539 (CVE-2021-37750)
description: Kerberos 5 contains a NULL pointer dereference vulnerability. An authenticated attacker could exploit this to cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2018-4441 (CVE-2018-1000880)
description: An infinite loop vulnerability has been discovered in Libarchive. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability through maliciously crafted WARC file to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2018-4454 (CVE-2018-1000879)
description: An attacker who can supply a specially crafted tar file to an application linking against libarchive can cause a denial-of-service (*DoS*) of the application.

name: BDSA-2018-4455 (CVE-2018-1000877)
description: libarchive is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via double free error. An attacker can send a victim a specially crafted RAR file that will cause the application to crash when opened.

name: BDSA-2018-4469 (CVE-2018-1000878)
description: A use-after-free vulnerability has been discovered in libarchive. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious RAR file to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2019-0225
description: A remote attacker who can supply a specially crafted RAR file to an application linking against, and using, libarchive can cause the application to crash resulting in denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2019-0304 (CVE-2019-1000019)
description: An attacker who can supply a specially crafted 7zip file to an application using and linking against libarchive can cause the application to crash, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2019-0321 (CVE-2019-1000020)
description: An attacker who can supply a specially crafted ISO9660 image file to an application using and linking against libarchive can cause the application to crash, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: CVE-2019-11463
description: A memory leak in archive_read_format_zip_cleanup in archive_read_support_format_zip.c in libarchive 3.3.4-dev allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted ZIP file because of a HAVE_LZMA_H typo. NOTE: this only affects users who downloaded the development code from GitHub. Users of the product's official releases are unaffected.

name: BDSA-2019-3419 (CVE-2019-18408)
description: Libarchive is vulnerable to use-after-free via the `archive_read_format_rar_read_data` function. This could cause a denial-of-service (DoS), crash, or allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

name: BDSA-2019-3620
description: Libarchive contains an out-of-bounds read flaw. This could be exploited by a remote attacker by supplying a specially crafted archive. If successfully exploited, the component will crash and a denial-of-service (DoS) will occur.

name: BDSA-2020-0285
description: libarchive is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS).  An attacker can use a crafted file with an invalid header to supply to a victim in order to cause libarchive to crash.

name: BDSA-2020-0307
description: It was discovered that libarchive contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this using a crafted file to cause a SIGSEGV fault triggering a DoS condition via an application crash.

name: BDSA-2018-2311 (CVE-2018-14048)
description: LibPNG is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper error handling.

name: BDSA-2019-4760
description: libarchive contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this by supplying a crafted file to cause a crash, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2021-2762
description:
libarchive is vulnerable to an ACL manipulation issue due to a lack of sufficient validation of archive entries.

When extracting a symbolic link (symlink) from an archive, the target file's ACL can be incorrectly modified. This could potentially allow an attacker to supply a crafted archive which, when extracted, could inadvertently allow access to otherwise restricted or sensitive files.

**Note**: This issue affects Linux systems.

name: BDSA-2021-2768
description:
libarchive is vulnerable to a file meta-data manipulation issue due to a lack of sufficient validation of 'fixup' entries.

When processing 'fixup' entries, symbolic links (symlinks) can be incorrectly followed meaning that link targets can be altered instead of directories that should be processed. This could potentially allow an attacker to supply a crafted archive which, when extracted, could inadvertently allow access to otherwise restricted or sensitive files.

**Note**: This issue affects Linux systems.

name: BDSA-2021-2769
description:
libarchive is vulnerable to a file flags manipulation issue due to how symbolic links (symlinks) can be followed when opening file descriptors to set file flags.

When extracting a symlink from an archive that follows a directory entry, the symlink target file's flags can be incorrectly modified. This could potentially allow an attacker to supply a crafted archive which, when extracted, could inadvertently allow access to otherwise restricted or sensitive files.

**Note**: This issue affects Linux systems.

name: BDSA-2017-0181 (CVE-2017-8871)
description: It was discovered that libcroco contains an infinite loop vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this flaw using a crafted CSS file to cause excessive CPU consumption resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2017-0182 (CVE-2017-7961)
description:
There is a flaw in libcroco that causes a Heap Buffer Overflow when an RGB value greater than the allotted range is read. 

The security implications of this vulnerability are disputed.

name: BDSA-2017-0176 (CVE-2017-8834)
description: It was discovered libcroco contains a forced memory allocation error. An attacker could exploit this flaw using a crafted CSS file to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2017-0368 (CVE-2017-7960)
description: `libcroco` vulnerable to a denial of service (DoS) attack via a maliciously crafted CSS file.

name: BDSA-2020-1118 (CVE-2020-12825)
description:
libcroco is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to uncontrolled recursion in the CRParser. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a victim with a maliciously crafted file.

**Note**: The vendor has archived this package as it is no longer maintained.

name: CVE-2013-0340
description: expat 2.1.0 and earlier does not properly handle entities expansion unless an application developer uses the XML_SetEntityDeclHandler function, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption), send HTTP requests to intranet servers, or read arbitrary files via a crafted XML document, aka an XML External Entity (XXE) issue.  NOTE: it could be argued that because expat already provides the ability to disable external entity expansion, the responsibility for resolving this issue lies with application developers; according to this argument, this entry should be REJECTed, and each affected application would need its own CVE.

name: BDSA-2019-1883 (CVE-2018-20843)
description: libexpat is vulnerable to a denial-of-service. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted XML document resulting in uncontrolled consumption of resources leading to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2019-2818 (CVE-2019-15903)
description: libexpat is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.  This allows remote attackers to cause applications, or systems, that pass untrusted input to the libexpat XML parsing library to crash due to memory corruption.

name: BDSA-2021-2995
description: Expat and Apache OpenOffice are vulnerable to a 'Billion Laughs' entity expansion attack. Successfully exploiting this could allow an attacker to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2018-5221
description: Libgcrypt is vulnerable to sensitive information disclosure. An attacker can take advantage of this by gaining access to the plaintext of data which has been improperly encrypted.

name: BDSA-2021-1710 (CVE-2021-33560)
description:
Libgcrypt is vulnerable to a plaintext recovery attack that affects OpenPGP ciphertexts that are encrypted using ElGamal due to a flaw in optimizations.

This issue could allow an attacker to compromise the use of ElGamal encryption and certain weak keys.

name: BDSA-2021-2708 (CVE-2021-40528)
description: Libgcrypt is vulnerable to information exposure due to the unsafe interaction of cryptographic components. An attacker could perform a cross-configuration attack in order to obtain the secret key that is being used in a communication session, which could in turn allow them to decrypt any communicated ciphertext.

name: BDSA-2018-2360 (CVE-2018-13785)
description: By tricking a user into opening a crafted PNG file in LibPNG an attacker can trigger an integer overflow resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2019-0034
description: libpng is vulnerable to a memory leak. An attacker could exploit this by tricking a user into downloading and loading a malicious file and causing a crash, leading to a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2019-0287
description: A use after free vulnerability has been discovered in LibPNG. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability via a crafted file to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2018-4849
description: LibPNG is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to a stack-based buffer overflow (write) in function` get_token`. An attacker can leverage this flaw by sending a maliciously crafted PNG file to a victim which triggers a crash in the library.

name: BDSA-2020-1904 (CVE-2020-16135)
description:
libssh is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition due to a NULL pointer dereference issue present in `src/sftpserver.c`.

A successful exploit for this issue can potentially affect the stability of the application and cause it to crash.

name: BDSA-2021-2609 (CVE-2021-3634)
description: libssh contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this in order to cause information exposure or a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2018-2912 (CVE-2018-1000654)
description: An attacker who can supply a user of Libtasn1 asn1Paser function can cause a denial-of-service (DoS) via high CPU usage and application crash.

name: BDSA-2017-1732
description: Libxml2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) or information disclosure attacks via a buffer overread vulnerability in the `htmlParseTryOrFinish` function located at `HTMLparser.c`.

name: BDSA-2018-1043 (CVE-2018-9251)
description: libxml2 is susceptible to a denial-of-service vulnerability.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by passing a maliciously crafted XML document to libxml2, resulting in an infinite loop.

name: BDSA-2018-2357 (CVE-2018-14404)
description: Libxml2 is Vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to missing checks when handling XML format inputs. An attacker could leverage this flaw to crash applications that make use of the library.

name: BDSA-2018-2797
description: Libxml2 is susceptible to a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  An attacker could exploit this flaw by passing a maliciously crafted XML document to libxml2, resulting in an infinite loop.

name: BDSA-2019-4050 (CVE-2019-19956)
description: libxml2 is vulnerable to information disclosure when the parsed XML document is `NULL`.

name: BDSA-2019-4208
description: libxml2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to an infinite loop. An attacker could provide a specially crafted XML file to the parser that could cause DoS.

name: BDSA-2020-0107
description: libxml2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the mismanagement of system memory resources. An attacker could cause a victim's instance of the application to crash by tricking them into running the application using crafted input.

name: BDSA-2020-2277
description: GNOME project libxml2 contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. Attackers can send maliciously crafted input to cause the process to crash, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2021-1278
description:
libxml2 is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition due to the presence of a heap use-after-free flaw in the `xmllint` functionality.

An attacker could supply a crafted file to `xmllint` in order to trigger the use-after-free causing instability and potentially a crash.

name: BDSA-2021-1279 (CVE-2021-3517)
description:
libxml2 is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) issue due to a lack of sufficient validation in the `entities.c` file.

An attacker could supply a crafted input in order to trigger a heap-based buffer overflow that causes instability and potentially a crash.

name: BDSA-2021-1281 (CVE-2021-3518)
description:
libxml2 is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) issue due to the presence of a heap use-after-free flaw in the `xinclude.c` file.

An attacker could supply a crafted file in order to trigger the use-after-free causing instability and potentially a crash.

name: BDSA-2021-1368 (CVE-2021-3537)
description:
libxml2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) conditions due to the presence of multiple NULL pointer dereference issues in the `valid.c` file.

An attacker could supply crafted XML mixed content in order to trigger one of the issues and potentially cause a crash.

name: BDSA-2021-1835 (CVE-2021-3541)
description: libxml2 is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via an exponential entity expansion attack that is able to bypass all protection mechanisms. This is a form of the [billion laughs attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billion_laughs_attack), which causes high CPU and RAM consumption.

name: BDSA-2020-1312
description: pam_setquota is vulnerable to allowing an unprivileged user to gain full control over which block device the quota is applied. A local attacker may leverage this to write more data than their quota should allow to a specified block device.

name: CVE-2019-6706
description: Lua 5.3.5 has a use-after-free in lua_upvaluejoin in lapi.c. For example, a crash outcome might be achieved by an attacker who is able to trigger a debug.upvaluejoin call in which the arguments have certain relationships.

name: BDSA-2018-3985 (CVE-2018-19211)
description: Ncurses is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) as it may end up referencing an empty memory region when parsing malformed files. An attacker can leverage this flaw to cause application crash by tricking a user into downloading and loading a crafted file.

name: BDSA-2018-3987 (CVE-2018-19217)
description: Ncurses is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) as it may end up referencing an empty memory region when parsing malformed files. An attacker can leverage this flaw to cause application crash by tricking a user into downloading and loading a crafted file.

name: BDSA-2019-3234 (CVE-2019-17595)
description: NCurses is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the mismanagement of system memory resources. An attacker could cause a victim's instance of the application to crash by tricking them into running the program using a crafted file as input.

name: BDSA-2019-3332 (CVE-2019-17594)
description: ncurses is vulnerable to a heap based buffer over-read. An attacker able to supply specially crafted input to a user of ncurses could cause the application to crash, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-4612 (CVE-2021-39537)
description: ncurses contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the supplied `captoinfo` tool. A local attacker who can supply specially crafted input could cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-1307 (CVE-2020-11080)
description:
nghttp2 is vulnerable to using excessive processing resources. A remote attacker who repeatedly sends a specially crafted request could cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

Node.js is also affected by this vulnerability.

name: BDSA-2019-2385 (CVE-2019-13565)
description: OpenLDAP contains a access control list (ACL) bypass.  This allows a remote attacker to perform certain LDAP operations such as searches and modifications without valid authorization.

name: BDSA-2019-2387 (CVE-2019-13057)
description: OpenLDAP contains an error that allows an administrative user of a database to obtain administrative control of any other database on the server.  This vulnerability may allow an authenticated attacker with `rootDN` privileges of a database to gain `rootDN` privileges of other databases.

name: BDSA-2020-0930 (CVE-2020-12243)
description: OpenLDAP vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to insufficient restrictions on LDAP queries. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a system with maliciously crafted LDAP requests.

name: CVE-2020-15719
description: libldap in certain third-party OpenLDAP packages has a certificate-validation flaw when the third-party package is asserting RFC6125 support. It considers CN even when there is a non-matching subjectAltName (SAN). This is fixed in, for example, openldap-2.4.46-10.el8 in Red Hat Enterprise Linux.

name: BDSA-2020-3096
description: OpenLDAP contains a vulnerability in the way normalization is handled. An attacker could exploit this flaw to cause the `slapd` daemon to crash and thus cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-3348 (CVE-2020-25692)
description:
OpenLDAP is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition due to a null pointer dereference issue present in the `servers/slapd/modrdn.c` file.

An attacker could send a crafted packet in order to cause a crash, impacting the availability of the service to other clients.

name: BDSA-2020-3393 (CVE-2020-25709)
description: OpenLDAP contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can take advantage of this by using a malicious packet to force an assertion failure and crash the application.

name: BDSA-2020-3394 (CVE-2020-25710)
description: OpenLDAP contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can take advantage of this by using a malicious packet to force an assertion failure and crash the application.

name: BDSA-2020-4105 (CVE-2020-36228)
description: OpenLDAP is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to an integer underflow condition. Remote attackers could exploit this via a malicious packet to cause an application crash.

name: BDSA-2020-4106 (CVE-2020-36227)
description: OpenLDAP contains an infinite loop vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this flaw to cause an excessive resource consumption resulting in denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2021-0201 (CVE-2020-36222)
description: OpenLDAP contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can take advantage of this by using a malicious packet to force an assertion failure and crash the application.

name: BDSA-2020-4107 (CVE-2020-36224)
description: OpenLDAP contains an invalid free vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue may allow attackers to cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-4109 (CVE-2020-36221)
description: OpenLDAP is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to an integer underflow condition. Remote attackers could exploit this via a malicious packet to cause an application crash.

name: BDSA-2021-0202 (CVE-2020-36225)
description: OpenLDAP is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper memory management. An attacker could exploit this flaw using a crafted packet to trigger a double, free resulting in a DoS condition.

name: BDSA-2020-4110 (CVE-2020-36223)
description: OpenLDAP contains a double free vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue may allow attackers to cause an out-of-bounds read, and trigger a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-4108 (CVE-2020-36229)
description: OpenLDAP is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to an unspecified attack vector. Remote attackers could exploit this via a malicious packet to cause an application crash.

name: BDSA-2020-4111 (CVE-2020-36230)
description: OpenLDAP  is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to a reachable assertion condition. Remote attackers could exploit this via a malicious packet to cause an application crash.

name: BDSA-2020-4113 (CVE-2020-36226)
description: OpenLDAP is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to an incorrect calculation. Remote attackers could exploit this via a malicious packet in order to cause an application crash.

name: BDSA-2021-0371 (CVE-2021-27212)
description: OpenLDAP contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can take advantage of this by using a malicious packet to force an assertion failure and crash the application.

name: BDSA-2020-3689 (CVE-2020-1971)
description: OpenSSL is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper type validation of X.509 fields. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a malicious certificate and certificate revocation list (CRL) to a target client or server.

name: BDSA-2021-0391 (CVE-2021-23840)
description: OpenSSL is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the improper handling of numeric values in memory. A remote attacker could cause a server to crash by sending maliciously crafted network traffic to that server.

name: BDSA-2021-0390 (CVE-2021-23841)
description: OpenSSL is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the improper management of system memory resources. A remote attacker could cause a server to crash by sending maliciously crafted network traffic to that server.

name: BDSA-2021-0399
description:
OpenSSL is vulnerable to SSL downgrade attacks due to erroneous logic whenever padding is being checked. An attacker could cause a victim's connection to be downgraded to a weaker SSL version via maliciously crafted packets with problematic padding.

It should be noted that only **1.0.2** branch releases with a non-default configuration are vulnerable.

name: BDSA-2021-0786 (CVE-2021-3449)
description:
OpenSSL TLS servers are vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition due to how `ClientHello` messages are mishandled.

An attacker could send the server a crafted renegotiation message in order to cause a NULL pointer dereference, resulting in a crash.

name: BDSA-2021-2579 (CVE-2021-3712)
description: OpenSSL is vulnerable to information exposure due to faulty logic that assumes that ASN.1 strings will always be null-terminated. A remote attacker could potentially recover sensitive data from the application's memory by causing it to process maliciously crafted ASN.1 strings. It may also be possible for an attacker to cause the application to crash.

name: BDSA-2021-2584 (CVE-2021-3711)
description: OpenSSL is vulnerable to remote code execution due to an problematic buffer length calculation. A remote attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable server, or cause that server to crash, by sending maliciously crafted SM2 data to that server.

name: BDSA-2020-4415 (CVE-2021-3200)
description: libsolv is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to a memory management error occurring when opening crafted files. This vulnerability causes libsolv to crash.

name: BDSA-2020-4604 (CVE-2021-33938)
description: libsolv contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue may allow attackers to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2020-4605 (CVE-2021-33928)
description: libsolv contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue may allow attackers to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2020-4606 (CVE-2021-33930)
description: libsolv contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue may allow attackers to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2020-4607 (CVE-2021-33929)
description: libsolv contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue may allow attackers to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2017-0068
description: Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in PCRE allows remote attack to cause a Denial of Service or other unspecified impact via maliciously crafted file.

name: BDSA-2017-0053
description: Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in PCRE allows remote attack to cause a Denial of Service or other unspecified impact via maliciously crafted file.

name: BDSA-2019-4251
description: The Perl Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) library is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via a buffer overread triggered by `\X` characters in non-UTF strings.

name: BDSA-2019-4437 (CVE-2019-20838)
description: PCRE libpcre is vulnerable to a buffer over-read flaw. An attacker who supplies specially crafted input could cause an application crash, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2020-1424 (CVE-2020-14155)
description: PCRE libpcre contains an integer overflow vulnerability. An attacker that is able to supply specially crafted input to an application utilizing libprce could cause it to crash, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: CVE-2019-20454
description: An out-of-bounds read was discovered in PCRE before 10.34 when the pattern \X is JIT compiled and used to match specially crafted subjects in non-UTF mode. Applications that use PCRE to parse untrusted input may be vulnerable to this flaw, which would allow an attacker to crash the application. The flaw occurs in do_extuni_no_utf in pcre2_jit_compile.c.

name: BDSA-2020-1044
description: pip is vulnerable to arbitrary code execution due to unsafe package management. An attacker that controls a public package with an identical name to the victim's private one may have their malicious package installed during dependency installation from a private Python Package Index (PyPI) server.

name: BDSA-2019-4637 (CVE-2019-20916)
description: pip is vulnerable to directory traversal due to the unsafe handling of a HTTP request field. A remote attacker could overwrite sensitive files on a victim's machine if they can trick that victim into installing a package from a malicious server. This could allow the attacker to access the victim's machine, or potentially execute arbitrary code.

name: BDSA-2021-1527
description: Python PIP is vulnerable to the installation of arbitrary revisions due to the improper handling of unicode separator characters. An attacker could cause a different git revision to be installed than what was intended by using a maliciously crafted reference field.

name: BDSA-2018-2216 (CVE-2018-1121)
description: Procps-ng allows an unprivileged attacker to hide processes through exploiting a race condition.

name: CVE-2018-1060
description: python before versions 2.7.15, 3.4.9, 3.5.6rc1, 3.6.5rc1 and 3.7.0 is vulnerable to catastrophic backtracking in pop3lib's apop() method. An attacker could use this flaw to cause denial of service.

name: CVE-2018-20406
description: Modules/_pickle.c in Python before 3.7.1 has an integer overflow via a large LONG_BINPUT value that is mishandled during a "resize to twice the size" attempt. This issue might cause memory exhaustion, but is only relevant if the pickle format is used for serializing tens or hundreds of gigabytes of data. This issue is fixed in: v3.4.10, v3.4.10rc1; v3.5.10, v3.5.10rc1, v3.5.7, v3.5.7rc1, v3.5.8, v3.5.8rc1, v3.5.8rc2, v3.5.9; v3.6.10, v3.6.10rc1, v3.6.11, v3.6.11rc1, v3.6.12, v3.6.7, v3.6.7rc1, v3.6.7rc2, v3.6.8, v3.6.8rc1, v3.6.9, v3.6.9rc1; v3.7.1, v3.7.1rc1, v3.7.1rc2, v3.7.2, v3.7.2rc1, v3.7.3, v3.7.3rc1, v3.7.4, v3.7.4rc1, v3.7.4rc2, v3.7.5, v3.7.5rc1, v3.7.6, v3.7.6rc1, v3.7.7, v3.7.7rc1, v3.7.8, v3.7.8rc1, v3.7.9.

name: BDSA-2019-0426 (CVE-2019-5010)
description: Python has a NULL pointer dereference vulnerability in the X509 certificate parser. A remote attacker can initiate or accept TLS connections using a specially crafted X509 certificate to trigger the NULL pointer dereference, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2019-0675 (CVE-2019-9636)
description: An improper handling of unicode encoding vulnerability has been discovered in Python. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability through a crafted URL to retrieve sensitive information, such as cookies or other authentication data from a cached hostname and send to a controlled hostname.

name: BDSA-2019-0745 (CVE-2019-9740)
description: An improper input validation vulnerability has been discovered in Python. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting malicious characters into the URL string to execute a HTTP response splitting attack against the system.

name: BDSA-2019-0819
description: Python is vulnerable to arbitrary file reads due to improper support of the two schemes in the `urllib` library. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass blacklisted `file:` URI protections and read arbitrary files on a victim's system within the privileges of the targeted application.

name: BDSA-2019-0821 (CVE-2019-9947)
description: Python is vulnerable to carriage return line feed (CRLF) injection due to improper input validation in the `urllib` library. This could allow an attacker to perform HTTP response splitting attacks by sending maliciously crafted HTTP headers.

name: BDSA-2019-1748
description: Python' s URL Parser is vulnerable to information exposure.  This allows a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information from applications using Pythons URL parser to process user supplied URLs. This vulnerability is a regression of CVE-2019-9636.

name: BDSA-2018-5012 (CVE-2018-20852)
description: Python is vulnerable to information disclosure through the http library by failing to confirm the origin of cookies before sending them.

name: BDSA-2019-2926 (CVE-2019-16056)
description: Pythons email module can be tricked into parsing an incorrect email domain.  If a system or application uses Pythons email module to process user supplied email addresses,  it may be possible for a remote attacker to perform unwanted actions or bypass restrictions.  This vulnerability has been used in known attacks against applications.

name: BDSA-2019-3122 (CVE-2019-16935)
description: Python contains a reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability.  This allows a remote attacker to inject JavaScript into a XML-RPC server title.  This can be used to perform web based attacks against a victim.  The vulnerability relies on the `DocXMLRPCServer` module being deployed and used in a certain way.  For these reasons, the severity of this should be assessed on a case to case basis.

name: BDSA-2019-3325 (CVE-2019-18348)
description: Python urllib is vulnerable to carriage return, line feed (CRLF) injection. A remote attacker able to control the hostname part of an url used by urllib could cause HTTP header injection.

name: BDSA-2018-5099
description: Python is vulnerable to data modification due to misleading documentation. An attacker could cause data to be modified or removed by tricking a developer into using an unsafe implementation of a poorly documented pattern-matching function.

name: BDSA-2019-4233 (CVE-2019-9674)
description: It was discovered that python contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this flaw using a zip bomb to trigger a DoS condition via excessive resource consumption.

name: BDSA-2020-0136 (CVE-2020-8315)
description: Python is vulnerable to unsafe DLL loading on Windows 7. Windows 8 and later are not affected by this issue. This may result in an attacker's malicious copy of `api-ms-win-core-path-l1-1-0.dll` being loaded and executed instead of the system copy.

name: BDSA-2020-0329 (CVE-2020-8492)
description: Python is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) due to uncontrollable resource consumption during HTTP authentication. A remote attacker able to set up a malicious HTTP server could cause a python process to consume large amounts of CPU time and memory.

name: BDSA-2020-1451 (CVE-2020-14422)
description: Python is vulnerable to a hash collision flaw. A remote attacker could cause a loss of performance and denial-of-service (DoS) by flooding an application that relies on functionality provided by IPv4Interface or IPv6Interface.

name: BDSA-2020-1616 (CVE-2020-15523)
description:
Python for Windows loads its core module from untrusted locations when trying to pre-load the `python3.dll` file. This means it could load another `python3.dll` file placed by an attacker which would execute arbitrary malicious instructions.

This issue is only triggered in applications that have Python embedded, but not running `python.exe` on its own.

name: BDSA-2019-4493 (CVE-2019-20907)
description: Python is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to an infinite loop. An attacker could provide a specially crafted TAR file to the `tarfile` module that could cause DoS.

name: BDSA-2020-2544 (CVE-2020-26116)
description: Python contains a HTTP header injection vulnerability due to the improper neutralization of carriage-return and line-feed (CRLF) characters. These special characters can be input into a request to add additional headers. An attacker that controls the HTTP method field could use this vulnerability to send malicious requests.

name: BDSA-2020-2928 (CVE-2020-27619)
description:
Python 3 is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to the usage of an unsafe functions within its test suite. An attacker with control of the `pythontest.net` server could exploit this to execute arbitrary code on all test suite build bots. Alternatively, an attacker who controls the network of a machine that is running the test suite could execute arbitrary code on that machine by generating crafted network traffic.

Only instances of the test suite which have enabled downloads over the network are vulnerable.

name: BDSA-2021-0085 (CVE-2021-3177)
description: Python is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to a buffer overflow caused by large floating point numbers. An attacker that could provide an arbitrary float number to the python application could cause it to crash and  in highly specialized circumstances, potentially achieve code execution.

name: BDSA-2021-0380 (CVE-2021-23336)
description: Python is vulnerable to web cache poisoning due to discrepancies in how proxies and servers view parameter separators. A remote attacker could cause victims to be served malicious content by sending crafted HTTP requests to a vulnerable server.

name: BDSA-2018-3801 (CVE-2018-15687)
description: A race condition vulnerability has been discovered in systemd. An attacker with local access could exploit this vulnerability to modify file permissions of arbitrary files.

name: CVE-2021-28359
description: The "origin" parameter passed to some of the endpoints like '/trigger' was vulnerable to XSS exploit. This issue affects Apache Airflow versions <1.10.15 in 1.x series and affects 2.0.0 and 2.0.1 and 2.x series. This is the same as CVE-2020-13944 & CVE-2020-17515 but the implemented fix did not fix the issue completely. Update to Airflow 1.10.15 or 2.0.2. Please also update your Python version to the latest available PATCH releases of the installed MINOR versions, example update to Python 3.6.13 if you are on Python 3.6. (Those contain the fix for CVE-2021-23336 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-23336).

name: BDSA-2021-1197 (CVE-2021-3426)
description: Python is vulnerable to directory traversal. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to access restricted resources and read arbitrary files on the disk.

name: BDSA-2017-4064
description:
Python contains a divide-by-zero vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this by supplying a crafted `.wav` file in order to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition. 

The Vendor disputes the validity of this issue, stating "if an application is vulnerable to a denial-of-service attack due to a faulty `.wav` file, it is a failure in that application to be handling possible exceptions from `wave.py`, not a security issue in Python itself.".

name: BDSA-2021-2824
description: Python's urllib component is vulnerable to regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) due to having exponential worst-case time complexity when handling HTTP authentication. A malicious server could send a crafted payload which would cause excessive computing resource consumption by the Python application.

name: BDSA-2021-3183
description: Python contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability due to improperly handled HTTP responses. An attacker can take advantage of this to make the HTTP client enter an infinite loop, consuming system resources and causing a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: CVE-2018-18074
description: The Requests package before 2.20.0 for Python sends an HTTP Authorization header to an http URI upon receiving a same-hostname https-to-http redirect, which makes it easier for remote attackers to discover credentials by sniffing the network.

name: CVE-2018-20060
description: urllib3 before version 1.23 does not remove the Authorization HTTP header when following a cross-origin redirect (i.e., a redirect that differs in host, port, or scheme). This can allow for credentials in the Authorization header to be exposed to unintended hosts or transmitted in cleartext.

name: CVE-2019-11236
description: In the urllib3 library through 1.24.1 for Python, CRLF injection is possible if the attacker controls the request parameter.

name: CVE-2019-11324
description: The urllib3 library before 1.24.2 for Python mishandles certain cases where the desired set of CA certificates is different from the OS store of CA certificates, which results in SSL connections succeeding in situations where a verification failure is the correct outcome. This is related to use of the ssl_context, ca_certs, or ca_certs_dir argument.

name: BDSA-2021-0813
description: RPM is vulnerable to remote code execution due to flaws in its signature check functionality when reading a package. An attacker may be able to use this vulnerability to execute malicious code on a target system.

name: BDSA-2021-1198 (CVE-2021-20266)
description: RPM contains an out of bound read vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this could allow an attacker to cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

name: BDSA-2021-1476 (CVE-2021-3421)
description: RPM is vulnerable to database corruption due to the improper handling of signature header values. An attacker could corrupt a victim's RPM database by tricking them into installing a maliciously crafted package.

name: BDSA-2021-3188
description: RPM contains an improper verification of cryptographic signature vulnerability due to the failure to validate binding signatures subkeys. If an attacker is able to add or convince another party to add a malicious subkey to a legitimate public key, this could cause RPM to wrongly trust a malicious signature resulting in a loss of data integrity.

name: BDSA-2018-2020
description: Shadow contains a privilege escalation vulnerability where a local attacker is able to bypass security restrictions to escalate their privileges and view previously unauthorized files.

name: BDSA-2012-0040
description:
shadow-utils contains a Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition vulnerability. A local attacker who has write privileges in a directory which has been removed or copied using the `usermod` or `userdel` command could conduct symbolic link attacks, allowing them to delete or modify other files on the system.

The vendor has stated that this vulnerability will not be fixed due to its low severity.

name: BDSA-2018-3769
description: Multiple functions has been discovered in Systemd to be utilizing an uninitialized value which can result in a crash. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2018-3798 (CVE-2018-15688)
description: A heap-based buffer overflow  vulnerability has been discovered in systemd. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by malicious spoofing as a valid DHCPv6 server to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2018-3820 (CVE-2018-15686)
description: An improper input validation vulnerability has been discovered in Systemd. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying an arbitrary state that influences system execution process to obtain root privilege escalation.

name: BDSA-2019-0031 (CVE-2018-16864)
description: Systemd is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to a flaw in the journald service which allows an attacker to allocate memory without limits. This can be exploited by passing several MB of arguments to a program calling the syslog function in order to cause a stack clash and a crash. This crash has been shown to be exploitable in some conditions and may allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code on the underlying host.

name: BDSA-2019-0033 (CVE-2018-16865)
description: Systemd is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to a flaw in the journald service which allows an attacker to allocate memory without limits. This can be exploited by passing many entries to the journal socket in order to cause a stack clash and a crash. This crash has been shown to be exploitable when combined with a separate information leak vulnerability (CVE-2018-16866) which allows an attacker to obtain the crucial missing pointer address information.

name: BDSA-2019-0040 (CVE-2018-16866)
description: Systemd is vulnerable to information disclosure due to incorrect parsing of log strings that end with a colon character. An attacker can leverage this flaw to gain insights into the systemd-journal process memory by supplying a crafted syslog message.

name: BDSA-2019-0502 (CVE-2019-6454)
description: Systemd is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) as it allocates memory on the stack based on the input provided in an attacker-controllable variable. A local attacker can leverage this flaw by sending a crafted D-Bus message on the system bus to cause a crash and kernel panic.

name: CVE-2019-3842
description: In systemd before v242-rc4, it was discovered that pam_systemd does not properly sanitize the environment before using the XDG_SEAT variable. It is possible for an attacker, in some particular configurations, to set a XDG_SEAT environment variable which allows for commands to be checked against polkit policies using the "allow_active" element rather than "allow_any".

name: BDSA-2019-1326 (CVE-2019-3844)
description: systemd is vulnerable to privilege escalation due to improper handling of services with the `DynamicUser` property. This could allow a local attacker to access resources with elevated privileges using recycled GIDs.

name: BDSA-2019-1311 (CVE-2019-3843)
description: systemd is vulnerable to privilege abuse due to improper handling of services with the `DynamicUser` property. This could allow a local attacker to access resources using recycled UIDs/GIDs.

name: BDSA-2018-4874
description: systemd is vulnerable to information disclosure due to improper error handling with inaccessible users. This could allow a local attacker (or an attacker with active ssh session) to view entered passwords on a victim's system.

name: BDSA-2018-5093 (CVE-2018-21029)
description: The systemd DNS resolver does not properly validate the hostname of certificates, allowing for a man-in-the-middle attack.

name: BDSA-2019-3847
description: Various VPN systems interact with the underlying operating system's packet routing subsystem in an insecure manner. A network adjacent attacker could discover sensitive information relating to VPN network connections, such as the sites that are being visited, and inject traffic into such sessions. They could accomplish this by tricking a victim into connecting to a malicious router or access point. Only route based VPNs are impacted.

name: BDSA-2019-4205 (CVE-2019-20386)
description: systemd contains a memory leak vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this to cause excessive memory consumption leading to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

name: BDSA-2020-0184 (CVE-2020-1712)
description: It was discovered that systemd contains a use-after-free vulnerability. A local unprivileged attacker could exploit this flaw by sending specially crafted Dbus messages to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition via application crash or in some instances elevate privileges or execute code.

name: BDSA-2020-1299 (CVE-2020-13776)
description: systemd is vulnerable to privilege escalation due to the incorrect interpretation of numerical usernames. An attacker could execute certain commands with arbitrary privileges on a vulnerable machine by using a maliciously crafted user name string.

name: BDSA-2021-1292
description: Systemd is vulnerable to DHCP ACK spoofing attacks. This could allow a local attacker to misconfigure a target device???s network interface which could potentially resulting in a denial-of-service for the victim.

name: BDSA-2021-2134 (CVE-2021-33910)
description: Systemd contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This vulnerability allows a local attacker to cause a complete system crash.

name: BDSA-2019-0564
description: FreeType is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to an unspecified flaw in the Type 1 font parser. An attacker can leverage this flaw to cause a heap buffer over-read and a crash by supplying a crafted Type 1 font file. The error might also return a byte of random memory.

name: BDSA-2020-2847 (CVE-2020-15999)
description: Freetype2 contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this using crafted `.ttf` files to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) via an application crash.

name: BDSA-2018-4395 (CVE-2018-20060)
description: An information exposure vulnerability has been discovered in urllib3. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to retrieve the authorization header value which could leak credential data.

name: BDSA-2019-1086 (CVE-2019-11236)
description: urllib3 is vulnerable to HTTP header injection due to improper neutralization of carriage return and line feed character sequence in the outbound headers. Potential attackers could leverage this flaw to attack internal services by abusing the trust relationship with the vulnerable client.

name: BDSA-2019-1124 (CVE-2019-11324)
description: urllib3 is vulnerable to improper authentication due to a flaw in the implementation of SSLContext parsing. An attacker could abuse this flaw to establish SSL connections that should normally fail.

name: BDSA-2020-2645 (CVE-2020-26137)
description: The Python urllib3 module is vulnerable to CRLF injection in a scenario where the attacker controls the HTTP request method. An attacker can take advantage of this to send malicious requests.

name: BDSA-2021-1688 (CVE-2021-33503)
description: urllib3 contains a flaw when handling regex expressions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) due to catastrophic backtracking.

name: BDSA-2021-2293 (CVE-2021-37600)
description: util-linux is vulnerable to a integer overflow leading to a buffer overflow, this could potentially allow an attacker to cause denial-of-service (DoS).
